summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackCocokind's Revitalizing Eye Cream is hydrating, refreshing, and reduces the look of dark circles and puffiness. Features a soothing, cooling metal tip.
details: DetailsBenefitsHydrates, refreshes, and revitalizes the eye areaReduces the appearance of bags and dark circles by moisturizing the contour of the under eyeLocks in hydration around the eyes (this area loses moisture 50% faster than the rest of your skin)Soothes and depuffs skin with a hygienic metal applicator tipItem 2582488How To UseGlide onto your eye area and gently pat in.IngredientsWater, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Glycerin, Cetearyl Alcohol, Glyceryl Stearates, Cetearyl Olivate, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Sorbitan Olivate, Potassium Cetyl Phosphate, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil**, Tetradecane, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Albizia Julibrissin Bark Extract***, Darutoside, Hibiscus Sabdariffa Flower Extract*, Avena Sativa (Oat) Kernel Extract, Xanthan Gum, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Dehydroacetate.*Certified Organic**Marula Oil***Persian Silk Tree Extract
how_to_use: Glide onto your eye area and gently pat in.
ingredients: Sodium Dehydroacetate.*Certified Organic**Marula Oil***Persian Silk Tree Extract

reviews.headline: Decent eye cream, but needs an easier way to clean metal tip
reviews.comments: Decent eye cream, but unfortunately for us acne prone people, there is no easy way to sanitize the metal tip with alcohol without it getting into the cream. If it was updated with a removable metal tip to clean easier, it would be much appreciated.. due to this inconvenience, my undereye is breaking out.

reviews.headline: CAUSED MILLIA AROUND EYES
reviews.comments: unfortunately, this product caused little hard white bumps (millia) to form under my eyes. the applicator is nice but the cream is very thick and not hydrating. my undereyes would burn after using this if i applied any other products. do not recommend for sensitive and acne prone skin :(

reviews.headline: Metal Part was Pointless
reviews.comments: I get that Cocokind was trying to make this product stand out in the oversaturated beauty market, but the solution was fine...there was no need to add the metal part. In fact, the metal part could cause sagging under the eyes if used too harshly. The metal part created a tugging feeling even when it was gently glided under the eyes. I agree with the most critical review. The eye cream didn't bring about any dramatic results, but take this part of my review with a grain of salt because I work a high-stress job and have to get up really early on the weekdays. How I would use this product is I would just squeeze the eye cream onto the top of my ring finger then gently dab the solution on my under eyes. I completely ignored the metal part.

reviews.headline: Eye cream
reviews.comments: It does deep moisturizing under the eye. I think its great to put some before using the concealer

reviews.headline: Ok
reviews.comments: My under eyes feel more dry after applying this cream. The applicator is nice, but I don't like the product formula.

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: Not as hydrating as I'd like and I do find that it burns my eyes. It just wasn't for me.

reviews.headline: Not great for aging undereyes
reviews.comments: This is a good moisturizing cream if you have dry undereyes or are in your 20s getting into eye creams howver it doesnt really brighten or help with bags. The metal tip applicator is cooling.

reviews.headline: It's alright
reviews.comments: I dislike the packaging on this because I don't understand why there is a twist off part when there is no need for it. Also the cap does not prevent the product from building up and hardening in the tube opening so it gets hard to get product out. And having to dig in the hole and clean it out is annoying! ALSO it does not wear well under makeup but to use as part of ur nightime routine is fine.

reviews.headline: Most hydrating eye cream ever
reviews.comments: Best eye cream I've ever used. I use a caffeine eye cream in the am to decrease puffiness but I rely on this product to plump my skin around my eyes at night. Better than hyped pricey products.

reviews.headline: not that great
reviews.comments: I got this cause everyone was raving about it. it basically made my eyes dry after using it once it dried down. when applying, it feels great. doesn't really help makeup look better. My makeup actually flakes off and is patchy when I use this first.

reviews.headline: Nice product I guess
reviews.comments: Great packaging and applicator fornula a bit to thick in my opinion

reviews.headline: Sensitive skin
reviews.comments: This dried out rhe skin around my eyes. Was really irritating. I wanted to love this so bas ! The applicator was really nice and there's a lot of product.

reviews.headline: Just Ok
reviews.comments: The cream is thick but the applicator is nice. Does it do anything? Not really. It's just a nice cream, but it is a bit sticky afterwards.

reviews.headline: Skin irritation and very dry
reviews.comments: Used this product last week and my skin was left dry. It is painful to put any products on my face now, as I have a burning sensation under my eyes. Returned this product.

reviews.headline: 4 out of 5 stars!
reviews.comments: I love the texture and the hydration but most of all the applicator and how it wears under makeup! The only con is i havent noticed a difference in brightening but that might be because i dont wear it every single day, only about 4 days of the week.  Besides that i love how it feels under my eyes at night for slugging and in the morning before makeup !!

reviews.headline: I wanted to love it but was disappointed
reviews.comments: I was excited to try out this product given it has so many good reviews, but was disappointed after I found out it pills very badly under makeup! I will say the metal applicator feels nice and cooling, and does help a bit with puffiness but I had to return it b/c it made my makeup separate and pill. Not really impressed by the quality of this eye cream, even on my no makeup days I didn't notice much difference in my dark circles or puffiness.

reviews.headline: Best applicator
reviews.comments: Best product feels as luxurious as some of the most expensive eye creams I've used in the past. I love the applicator and the fact that it's metal really helps with swelling. The cream itself is not too thick or thin. For reference, I am a 30 something year-old chocolate queen, who is combo oily and acne prone (but dry under eyes!).

reviews.headline: Working it's magic
reviews.comments: This product shows you results in just about a week, it's unique cool wand pressed again your skin to apply is cool! Pat any left...works well under makeup!

reviews.headline: Not horrible, but definitely not good
reviews.comments: The applicator and price points are the only good thing about this. I've been using this for months, as finding a good affordable night time eye cream is hard to find. I often wake up with irritated and dry under eyes. The thick texture is misleading. Even though it initially feels like a thick, rejuvenating eye cream, it does nothing. The metal applicator is great tho.

reviews.headline: love this!
reviews.comments: this product is amazing!! the metal applicator adds a nice cooling effect and helps reduce my puffing. you do need to give it a good rub in, not tap, in order to get good application. i do gentle circles around my eyes to help with circulation and ensure its rubbed in

faceoff_positive.comments: I really appreciate the honesty of cocokind in their branding and advertising of their products and one thing they posted a lot about around the release of this eye cream was that there are a lot of things that are unchangeable about the eye area. For me, the bone structure of my face and the way shadows are cast always make my undereyes seem VERY dark even if I am well rested (this is really common among South and Central asians) and it is something I regularly have to remind myself, seeing the company remind people about it too is something I think is very important and I enjoyed seeing. Now, in terms of this cream. I get really dry patches of skin really often and never realized how dry the undereyes can get before I began reading about it on the cocokind socials, I used to use my matcha on the undereyes but decided to give this a try when it was released and I LOVE it. It has helped a lot with how makeup used to settle into the lines under my eyes, and now that I changed the makeup I use too it doesn't at all ! The metal tip feels so refreshing and helps sort of gently wake me up when I get ready in the morning, and it absorbs very nicely and a lot quicker than I expected. I have never really been one for eye creams because I didn't understand them and didn't notice differences previously, but the effectiveness of this product along with the information behind it from cocokind has done a lot in terms of learning about the skin in general, learning about MY skin, and meeting goals with my skin. I love it.
faceoff_positive.headline: Effective product with the education to back it

faceoff_negative.comments: this is a thick cream that when spread it feels nice under the eyes, and it has a metal tip which can be refreshing, but i am maybe one or two days from finishing my first purchase of this (will have to try really hard to squeeze the last drops at this point), and i haven't particularly noticed anything. i've used it morning and night and have noticed no difference in my dark circles or under eye hydration. i actually did enjoy having this in my skincare routine just because it feels nice to apply, and even though i was really interested in seeing how its ingredients would work, it didn't noticeably do anything after a month (and now i've reached the end of my bottle). it also has such a small amount of product in comparison to other eye cream from skincare brands that ulta carries, and for the same price, so i'll just try something else next.
faceoff_negative.headline: pleasant to use but doesn't do anything
